project.teaser: The objective of the European Green Deal policy is to be climate-neutral by 2050. However, the key problem of the industry transition towards climate neutrality is that the combined response of demand, global trade and industrial production to policy measures is highly...
project.objective: The objective of the European Green Deal policy is to be climate-neutral by 2050. However, the key problem of the industry transition towards climate neutrality is that the combined response of demand, global trade and industrial production to policy measures is highly complex. The aim of the AMIGDALA project is to facilitate decision makers in governments and in the EU’s industries to define and evaluate pathways towards climate neutrality, circularity and sustainability. In this project we combine insights in decision-making with integrated modelling of scenarios to analyze transformation pathways. We analyze decisions-making in government and in industry by the control options that they have such as incentives, regulatory measures and investments in capital projects to contribute to the Green Deal’s objectives. We deliver an integrated model to represent EU industry’s transformation pathways up to 2070 and cover historical developments from 1990. We develop a method to combine established models of separate domains and let them operate as-one. This integrated model shows the combined effect of control options on economy, trade, energy, materials flow, biomass and industrial production on an EU systems-level and within a global context. On a local-level we use models to analyze the decisions by industry clusters to invest in transformative solutions and utility operators to build infrastructure. With the integrated model we run scenarios that we develop on the basis of the control options of decisionmakers to achieve industrial transformation towards climate neutrality. The integrated model allows to analyze the effect of framework conditions on the uptake of transformative solutions and products and on energy demand, emissions, and material use. The AMIGDALA consortium has a deep and shared knowledge of technologies, economy, life cycle analysis and complex systems modelling and decision support analysis.
project.title: Alliance for Modelling Industries towards the Green Deal’s objectives And circuLArity
project.keywords: Industry Transformation Modelling Scenario Pathway Decision Government Industry Policy Investment Circularity Economy Demand Trade Production Feedstock Biomass Waste Greendeal Sector Analysis System

result.title: Dissemination and communication plan No. 1
result.description: First version of the D&C plan of the project.

result.title: Working procedure and data exchange tables for interaction between models, database, scenarios and dashboard
result.description: Deliver a detailed guide specifying how various project components, including models, databases, scenarios, and the dashboard, interact and exchange data effectively.

result.title: Dissemination and communication plan No. 2
result.description: Second version of the D&C plan of the project, monitoring the KPIs established to track partners’ activities.

result.title: The Circular Industrial Transformation System (CITS) model - Assessing the life cycle impacts of climate and circularity strategies

details.authors: A.E. Schwarz, S.M.C. Lensen, S.D.M. Herlaar, T. van Harmelen, P.H. Stegmann

result.title: Report describing D-framework and integrated model architecture design
result.description: The report is a detailed analysis and development need of all key aspects of the project: an inventory of public and private stakeholders, their mandate & dependency on other stakeholders, the economic indicators and target values most relevant to them and control levers directly and indirectly under their control. The information is compounded into a decision analysis logical framework based on weighted key aspects of sustainability (including the five dimensions) to allow multi-criteria decision analysis aggregation functions to be developed. The report presents a gap-analysis and development need of the sub-models. The report indicates the conclusions on integrated model architecture and the selection of pivotal variables on which to co-converge the system of sub-models. The report indicates the data-demand for historic economic data and the data required by the models to make projections. The report indicates main drivers for change and identifies key uncertainties control levers of stakeholders and background scenarios that will be the input for the development of foreground scenarios.

result.title: Report discussing lessons learnt from PoC for further development
result.description: The report is an evaluation of the process through which we have linked stakeholder decisions to models & data and to scenario development. It addresses the aspects that have been concluded and those that may still need to be addressed before technical completion.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
